titlestmt.titleproper: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, Finding Aids for Related Collections, RG 11
A Guide to the John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, Finding Aids for Related Collections, RG 11 FA1805

did.unittitle: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, Finding Aids for Related Collections, RG 11

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Record Group 11 contains copies of finding aids for related collections that are not part of the Knight Foundation records at Rockefeller Archive Center.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Knight Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Knight Foundation.

did.unittitle: Knight Commission on Intercollegiate Athletics, University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Finding aid for the Commission's records. KF archives maintains a small collection of materials.

did.unittitle: The John S. Knight Papers, University of Akron

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Inventory to the John S. Knight Papers, 1894-1983, housed by the Archival Services department of the University of Akron. The finding was composed in 1987, and contains a biographical note about John S. Knight, and a box and folder list of the records and series. This was a preliminary attempt at organizing the materials.

did.unittitle: The John S. Knight Papers (Revised), University of Akron

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Revised inventory of the John S. Knight Papers in the Archival Services division of the University of Akron Library. Revised when the collection was reprocessed in 1997 in accordance with a Knight Foundation grant in 1985, the inventory contains a biographical note, scope and content note and box inventory of the 100 cubic-foot collection.
